Class PlayArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • uno.ui.screens.PlayArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IScreen

    public class PlayArea
extends java.lang.Object
implements IScreen
    Displays the area where the game is played
    Version:
    2017-03-17
    Author:
    Betina Andersson & Shahad Naji

      Adds a card to the panel showing the cards, adds an action if pressed to play the card

      Gets the player related to the provided uuid

      Handles messages that contain the info about what cards the player have
      The cards are provided in their string representations with a # between each individual info
      void handleMessage(java.lang.Object o)
      Handles all the messages received during a game
      private void handlePairMessages(Pair o)
      Handles messages that has the base object as a pair instance
      The messages that uses that are when a new round is starting and when info about a played card is received
      private void handlePlayerInfoMessage(java.util.ArrayList list)
      Saves the lists of info about the players and updates the on screen info
      private void handleRequestMessage(java.lang.String message)
      Handles when a request for user input is needed from the server
      void hide()
      Hides the window from showing.
      The window should either be closed or hidden here as a new screen is about to be shown.
      void setMain(Main main)
      Provides a reference to the Main instance that is showing the screen.
      void show()
      Starts showing the screen, only called when a window is changed to.
      Setup the window and start showing it here.
      private void updateCards()
      Updates the cards shown on the screen by removing all and adding them back
      private void updatePlayerInfo()
      Updates the names, card amounts and if the player has said Uno at the top of the scree
      Updates only if the info about both players and card amount has been received
      Adds half of the players on one side of the Uno button and the other half on the other side
      private void updateTurnText()
      Updates the turn text about who's turn it is

        private void updatePlayerInfo()
        Updates the names, card amounts and if the player has said Uno at the top of the scree
        Updates only if the info about both players and card amount has been received
